intro: Plantago myosuros var. major, commonly known as the greater plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces dense clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their soothing and anti-inflammatory properties. The species is adaptable to a variety of soil types and is commonly found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
